author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
The State Government has sanctioned relief amount to 23 farmers raising Bengal gram in the district who sustained yield losses during the recent North East monsoon.

Joint Director of Agriculture A. Mahendran told The Hindu that the amount was sanctioned at the rate of Rs. 7,410 a hectare for a total area of 19.43 hectares spread over Anthiyur and Poolankinar areas, both falling under Udumalpet block.

Of the beneficiary farmers, 21 of them cone under the classification 'small and marginal farmers,' and the remaining 'large farmers'.

The amount would be shortly disbursed to the beneficiary farmers through the Primary Agriculture Cooperative Credit Societies at Anthiyur and Poolankinar.

“A team of officials from the agriculture department assessed the damages after the farmers complained that water from jungle streams in the area ran through their farms during monsoon causing the damages,” said Mr. Mahendran. Only the farmers who sustained yield losses of more than 33 per cent were eligible for the relief amount, he added.
title: Relief sanctioned to 23 farmers
